title: 1. Background and Scope
content:
The contractor shall perform the tasks required by this call in accordance with all sections of the blanket purchase agreement (BPA) and this call. U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Office of Chief Information Officer (OCIO) is seeking Microsoft Engineering and Technical Support Services to provide technical support for OPM program office requirements, as well as OCIO office requirements to automate business processes. The vendor will use Power Platform technologies for these solutions including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Adobe PDF form logic, Adobe Acrobat Sign (via Power Automate connectors), possibly other eSignature tools such as DocuSign, and Dynamics. Data for these processes may be stored in Excel, SharePoint, Dataverse, Azure SQL, SQL Server, or other entities. 
Likely projects may include (but not limited to) supporting the OCIO organization in collaboration with OPM Program Offices (i.e., Employee Services, etc.) to automate processes for human resource process automation; OPO Process Automation; OCIO Resource Management Office (RMO) Process Automation; and OCIO Enterprise Change Management (ECM) Process Automation, and electronic signature applications such as the “Health Benefits Confirmation or Declination” process.

title: 2. Period of Performance
content: The period of performance for this BPA Call order will be for one year. Performance shall begin with a 30-days ramp up for the vendor to designate their staff and have time for OPM to obtain security clearances for the staff. It is expected that the vendor will have its full team to begin supporting the task by the performance start date, pending any Government specific delays.

title: 3. Key Personnel
content:
The following labor categories is designated as Key Personnel for this BPA Call Order: Senior Project Manager (Task 1), and Enterprise Administrator Expert (Task 2) Resumes for Key Personnel shall contain documented experiences and certifications directly applicable to the functions to be performed in accordance with the labor category descriptions found in RFQ Attachment 2 and the table below. Further, these prior work experiences shall be specific and of sufficient variety and duration that the employee is able to effectively and efficiently perform the functions assigned.
ROLE MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
0 Task 1 NaN
1 Senior Project Manager (Key Personnel) (1 FTE)  Working knowledge of the Microsoft suite of cloud products and platforms included in thisCall Order, including Azure, Office 365 and Power BI  Experience working on projects or programs with similar scope and product mix  Experience utilizing Agile program and projectmanagement tools to plan, execute, and measure project success  Demonstrated Agile experience, ensuring that the technical expectations of deliverables are met  Ability to effectively collaborate across organizational barriers to accomplish high priority and high visibility goals
2 Task 2 NaN
3 Enterprise Administrator Expert (Key Personnel) (1 FTE)  Demonstrated experience designing, implementing, and managing user identity and roles, managing access and authentication, planning Office 365 workloads and applications, implementing modern device services, implementing Microsoft 365 security and threat management, and managing Microsoft 365 governance and compliance at Enterprise-scale  Experience working in an Agile environment – working as a part of (and across) teams to iteratively develop and deliver data products
4 Task 3 NaN
5 Microsoft Power Platform App Maker Associate (4 FTE)  Has experience implementing Power Platform solutions with specialized skills in Power Apps, Power Automate, and Dataverse  Has Microsoft certification in Power Platform technologies  Experience in mapping business flows to Microsoft Power Platform technologies  Experience working in an Agile-based team and reporting work in an Agile-based toolset (e.g., Microsoft Azure DevOps)  Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences (orally and in written form)
6 Task 4 NaN
7 Azure Data Engineer Associate (1 FTE)  Experience work with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translating those needs into Power BI visualizations.  Experience with different models of sharing Power BI reports (e.g., through SharePoint, Teams, Power Apps, websites, etc.)  Has Microsoft certification in Power BI technology  Experience with mix of R, DAX, PowerQuery languages for data analytic tasks
8 Task 5 NaN
9 SharePoint Associate (1 FTE)  Experience designing and implementing applications in Microsoft SharePoint to satisfy business needs. This will include experience with SharePoint Online.  Microsoft SharePoint certification is required.  Experience developing solutions for business process automation, designing and developing custom SharePoint sites, pages, libraries, lists, views, and workflows; troubleshooting SharePoint application and environment issues, and participating in stakeholder meetings for requirements, training, and delivery of solutions.  Working with Stakeholders to define SharePoint application requirements  Designing and developing SharePoint applications including data security and privacy requirements  Testing, training, and delivering Microsoft applications  Monitoring, diagnosing, and responding to user support tickets related to existing SharePoint applications
10 Task 6 NaN
11 Dynamics 365 + Power Platform Solution Architect Expert (2 FTE)  Has deep experience designing, testing, and implementing across the full set of Dynamics and Power Platform Solutions.  Experience in how Azure Active Directory can be used for authentication to Power Platform solutions  Experience in securing Power Platform solutions so that different groups of people have permission and ability to see their information or workflows  Has Microsoft certification in Power Platform technologies.  Experience in process analysis and business process re-engineering  Experience in mapping business flows to Microsoft Power Platform technologies  Experience in Microsoft licensing of Power Platform technologies and (preferred) Microsoft licensing for the federal Government  Experience designing technical solutions, understanding
12 NaN complex application data flows, and bridging the gap between business application requirements  Experience working in an Agile-based team and reporting work in an Agile-based toolset (e.g., Microsoft Azure DevOps)  Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences (orally and in written form)  Ability to lead small (1 – 3 person team) as technical lead for developing and delivering solutions
13 Task 7 NaN
14 Dynamics 365 Customer Service Functional Consultant Associate (1 FTE)  Has experience designing, testing, and implementing Power Platform Solutions with specialized skills in Dynamics Customer Service Platform.  Experience in securing Dynamics solutions so that different groups of people have permission and ability to see their information or workflows  Has Microsoft certification in Dynamics and/or Power Platform technologies.  Experience in process analysis and business process re-engineering  Experience in mapping business flows to Microsoft Dynamics technologies  Experience designing technical solutions that require understanding complex application data flows and bridging the gap between business application requirements  Experience working in an Agile-based team and reporting work in an Agile-based toolset (e.g., Microsoft Azure DevOps)  Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences (orally and in written form)

title: 4. Non-Key Personnel
content: Labor categories not designated as Key Personnel shall be considered Non-Key Personnel.

subsections.title: 5.1 Task 1: Project Management Services
subsections.content:
The Contractor shall provide a Senior Project Manager to provide end-to-end program and project management for all tasks in this Call Order. As part of this Call Order, the contractor must establish and maintain a comprehensive program plan, respective project plans, and corresponding implementation schedules for multiple and concurrent work streams, from initial identification through completion. It is preferred that the contractor use appropriate best practices and an agile project management methodology(where appropriate) for implementation of engineering and technical services. 
The contractor shall collaborate with the System Owner and key OPM stakeholders to manage and deliver program initiatives. The contractor shall conduct knowledge transfer, strategy, 
architecture, and design activities as part of this implementation effortas deemed necessary for efficient implementation. 
The Senior Project Manager shall: 
● 
Serve as primary POC with Government project manager(s) and COR to ensure that deliverables are fulfilled, managing Performance Requirements in the Quality Assurance Surveillance Plan (QASP) and managing agreed-upon schedules. 
● 
Establish and maintain a comprehensive project plan using Microsoft Project and implementation schedule for multiple concurrent work streams from initial identification throughcompletion, using appropriate best practices and an agile project managementmethodology for product delivery. 
● 
Establish and maintain backlog of work activities to manage team using Microsoft Azure DevOps (ADO). 
● 
Identify delivery and/or operational risks associated with the development and configuration of Azure, Dynamics, Office 365, Power Platform, and Power BI, including analysis and classification of risk severity and likelihood, and recommended mitigation strategies. 
● 
Coordinate with OPM OCIO governance bodies (e.g., ERB, CRB) and executive steering committees to present recommendations and secure appropriate approval from the Government. 
● 
Support the government with development of proposals for the Enterprise Configuration Management (ECM) process when required. 
● 
Manage contractor personnel to fulfill tasks and deliverables on schedule and within specified performance standards as agreed upon with the COR and OCIO leadership team. 
● 
Facilitate coordination and transitions amongst various tasks and corresponding personnel throughout the BPA Call period of performance. 
● 
Submit status updates and project management documentation as required by OPM and OCIO reporting requirements. 
● 
Provide/coordinate technical support for Office 365, Dynamics, Azure, Power Platform, or Power BI for the requested services.

subsections.title: 5.2 Task 2: Enterprise Technical Engineering and Consulting Services
subsections.content: The Contractor shall provide daily advice, design, implementation, and operational support on key Microsoft technologies in use at OPM, and enhanced problem resolution support. This support will specifically help the OPM staff in properly architecting, configuring, implementing, and monitoring the utilization of Microsoft technologies in use at OPM. The type of technical support required includes engineering, architecture, configuration, troubleshooting, and operational support for the OPM Microsoft environments.

subsections.title: 5.3 Task 3: Collaboration Specialist I – Microsoft Power Platform App Maker Associate
subsections.content:
The Contractor shall provide Collaboration Specialist I consultants to provide implementation services for a planned set of process automation projects and maintenance of existing projects to support OPM business needs. The team members will meet with business stakeholders to define requirements for the projects and features, and refine the requirements into designs for stakeholder review and approval. The team members will participate in implementation, testing, stakeholder demonstrations, and deployment of applications. 
The Collaboration Specialist I consultants shall provide and coordinate activities using Power Platform, SharePoint, and SQL Server for implementation of the planned projects. 
In coordination with OCIO Information Technology Strategy and Policy’s staff, the Collaboration Specialist I consultants will plan each Agile Sprint of the project and coordinate on project milestones to monitor project progress. Planning and progress on activities will be documented in OPM’s Azure DevOps (ADO) system. 
The Collaboration Specialist I consultants will participate in Agile-based meetings (e.g., Scrums, Sprint Planning, and Sprint Retrospectives) and tasking will be managed in Azure DevOps where the team member will make updates to document progress on activities.

subsections.title: 5.4 Task 4: OPM Systems Modernization and Analytics Support
subsections.content:
The focus of this task is to support the modernization of the OCIO systems by building solutions within the OPM-managed Azure cloud environment that are scalable and can be sustained long-term. OPM expects to utilize Microsoft tools such as PowerBI and embedded visualization components for advanced analytics and making Federal data more accessible to OCIO customers and stakeholders. 
In coordination with OCIO Information Technology Strategy and Policy’s staff, the Azure Data Engineer Associate consultant will plan each Agile Sprint of the project and coordinate on project milestones to monitor project progress. Planning and progress on activities will be documented in OPM’s Azure DevOps (ADO) system.

subsections.title: 5.5 Task 5: OPM SharePoint Development and Environment Support
subsections.content:
The focus of this task is to support OPM in creating and maintaining customized SharePoint solutions. The Contractor will be responsible for configuring and customizing SharePoint systems according to OCIO specifications, building scalable web applications, writing and modifying code, debugging software, and training OPM staff. Some of the Contractor responsibilities (but not limited to) include: 
 
Meeting with the OPM staff to review website and application requirements. 
 
Setting tasks and development goals. 
 
Configuring the OPM SharePoint systems to specified requirements. 
 
Developing new web components using current IT technology (i.e., XML, .NET, SQL, etc.). 
 
Designing, coding, and implementing scalable applications. 
 
Extending SharePoint functionality with forms, web parts, and application technologies. 
 
Testing and debugging code. 
 
Reviewing website interface and software stability. 
 
Troubleshooting software issues. 
 
Maintaining and updating SharePoint applications. 
 
Providing systems training to staff and customers. 
In coordination with OCIO Information Technology Strategy and Policy’s staff, the SharePoint Associate consultant will plan each Agile Sprint of the project and coordinate on project milestones to monitor project progress. Planning and progress on activities will be documented in OPM’s Azure DevOps (ADO) system.

subsections.title: 5.6 Task 6: Solutions Architect II – Dynamics 365 + Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
subsections.content:
The Contractor shall provide Solutions Architect II staff to provide implementation services for a planned set of process automation projects to support OPM business needs. The team members will meet with business stakeholders to define requirements for the projects and 
refine the requirements into designs for stakeholder review and approval. The team members will lead activity with the other resource associated with scope of work, the Consultant II. The team members will lead implementation, testing, stakeholder demonstrations, and deployment of applications. 
The Solutions Architect II staff shall provide and coordinate activities using Dynamics 365, Power Platform, SharePoint, Adobe PDF form logic, Adobe Acrobat Sign (via Power Automate connectors), possibly other eSignature tools such as DocuSign and SQL Server for implementation of the planned projects. 
In coordination with ITSP’s staff, the Solutions Architect II staff will plan each Agile Sprint of the project and coordinate on project milestones to monitor project progress. 
The Solutions Architect II staff will participate in Agile-based meetings (e.g., Scrums, Sprint Planning, and Sprint Retrospectives) and tasking will be managed in Azure DevOps where the team member will make updates to document progress on activities.

subsections.title: 5.7 Task 7: Consultant II – Dynamics 365 Customer Service Functional Consultant Associate
subsections.content:
The Contractor shall provide a Consultant II to provide implementation services for a planned set of Dynamics 365 OPM business needs. The team member will meet with business stakeholders to define requirements for the projects and refine the requirements into designs for stakeholder review and approval. The team member will support the vendor’s Solutions Architect II. The team member will participate in implementation, testing, stakeholder demonstrations, and deployment of applications. 
The Consultant II shall provide and coordinate activities using Dynamics, Power Platform and SQL Server for implementation of the planned projects. 
In coordination with ITSP’s staff, the Consultant II will plan each Agile Sprint of the project and coordinate on project milestones to monitor project progress. 
The Consultant II will participate in Agile-based meetings (e.g., Scrums, Sprint Planning, and Sprint Retrospectives) and tasking will be managed in Azure DevOps where the team member will make updates to document progress on activities.

title: 6. Deliverables
content:
The Contractor shall review deliverables with the Federal project lead (e.g., product owner) before submitting the following deliverables to the COR and OCIO Project Manager as scheduled. If the COR or OCIO Project Manager does not respond with acceptance of a deliverable within five (5) business days of submission, then the deliverable will be considered accepted.
Deliverable Description Delivery Date
0 Call Order Kickoff Meeting All identified Contractor Key Personnel, as well as a representative from the Contractor's contracts organization, are required to attend. The intent of the kickoff is for all key personnel to meet to discuss the project's overall technical and contractual requirements; review roles, responsibilities, and majortasks. Within 30 calendar days of award or as agreed to by the COR
1 Monthly Status Report The Contractor shall provide a monthly status report that shall be limited to four pages in length (length maybe extended if necessary to communicate the issues identified below). The monthly status report shall include at a minimum the following:  Resource planning and financial summary forthe call order  Risks and issues (technical, management, contractual) and corresponding mitigations or remedies  Planned activities and scheduled completion dates  Status of deliverables and associated milestones, if applicable.  Documented recommendations, best practices,and any other technical guidance provided during the month NLT the 10th of each month
2 Sprint Planning Epics/Features/User Stories included in the Sprint Backlog to be documented in OPM’s ADO 3 calendar days prior to Sprint planning meeting or as agreed to by the COR or OCIO Project Manager
3 Sprint Review documents to include user stories with full descriptions and acceptance criteria During the day of Sprint Planning or as agreed to by the COR or OCIO Project Manager
4 Release Planning Documentation Within 3 calendar days of the Release Planning Meeting oras agreed to by the COR or OCIO Project Manager
5 Ad-hoc Work Products and Analysis Reports (as needed) As directed by the COR or OCIO Project Manager
6 Design Documents All design documents or artifacts supporting the Dynamics 365 Design, Power Platform design, or SharePoint Design, Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD), and the like, be provided to the COR as well as the OCIO Project Manager and kept up to date during the duration of the contract. As agreed to by the COR or OCIO Project Manager

title: 7. QUALITY ASSURANCE SURVEILLANCE PLAN (QASP)
content:
The Government shall evaluate the Contractor's performance under this call order in accordance with the Quality Assurance Surveillance Plan (QASP). This plan is primarily focused on what the Government must do to ensure the Contractor has performed in accordance with the performance objectives. Please see Table 1 for full text. This planmay be revised by mutual agreement at the Kick-Off Meeting. Table 1.
Performance Requirement (Task / Deliverable) Performance Standard(s) Minimum Acceptable Quality Level(s) Method of Surveillance Incentive / Disincentive
0 Staffing Contractor shall maintain staffing levels as detailedin its quotation. On a monthly average, at least 90% of Contractor’s teamis maintained. 100% Inspection: Government will review invoices against required personnel. Incentive: If Contractor performs in accordance with the standard/AQL then favorable comments will be documented in CPARS. Disincentive: Contractor shall discount its monthly invoice by 7% when monthly average staffing level falls below 90%. Discount shall be applied for the month being billed. Additionally, negative feedback will be included in CPARS.
1 Staffing (Turnover) Employees shall be onboarded within 30 days of vacancy opening. On a monthly average, at least 90% of contractor staff must be onboarded within this timeframe. 100% Inspection: Government will review invoices against Call Order1 proposed personnel. Contractor shall discount its monthly invoice by 7% when less than 90% of new contractor staff arenot onboarded within the 30 day timeframe.
2 Monthly Contractor Reports Contractor shall provide reports ina timely manner 100% on time and comprehensive Receipt and review by the COR Incentive: If Contractor performs in accordance with the standard/AQL then favorable comments will be documented in CPARS Disincentive: If Contractor fails to perform in accordance with the Performance Standard/AQL, then unfavorable comments will be documented in CPARS.
3 Client Satisfaction (All Tasks) Contractor shall provide timely and professional services and expertise by performing the activities and providing support under all tasks. Client satisfaction monthly score will bea rolling 3-month average of 3.5 or higher (1-5 scale). Random sampling: Government will administer and collect client (OPM employees) feedback through asatisfaction survey (Appendix 1) on a monthly basis. Incentive: If Contractor performs in accordance with the standard/AQL then favorable comments will be documented in CPARS. Disincentive: Contractor shall reduce its monthly invoice by 1% for each month client satisfaction average falls below 3.5.

title: 8. Travel
content:
Travel shall be limited to occasions directed by the CO and COR and is not expected to exceed $5,000 per annum. Contractor will be required to adhere to the policies and procedures in effect for the location while on-site. 
Reimbursement for travel shall be in accordance with the Federal Travel Regulations. Reimbursement of local travel and commuting expenses are not authorized. Local will not be reimbursed within a 50-mile radius of the worksite. The worksite shall be considered as the location of the Contractor’s on-site personnel. The Contractor shall seek Government approval from the COR in advance of incurring any expenses associated with travel. The Contractor shall provide estimated costs, including any quotes, with is approval request. Allowable and reasonable costs incurred by the Contractor will be reimbursed within the “not-to-exceed” ceiling established in the pricingschedule. The Contractor shall not invoice the Government for any associated fee or profit above the actual costs incurred for travel. Once proposed costs are approved by the Government, the Contractor shall not exceed the established ceiling.

title: 9. Place of Performance
content:
This work performed under this Call order shall be performed at a combination of locations. Due to the COVID-19 restrictions, the Contractor is expected to work remotely. 
Attachment 2 – Labor Category Descriptions and (Excel Spreadsheet Attached Separately)

subsections.title: 10.1 BPA Call Terms and Conditions
subsections.content:
The BPA Call awarded as a result of this solicitation shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this RFQ as well as those within the Quoter’s BPA and GSA Schedule contract.  
The terms and conditions presented within the request for quote and ultimate award apply to the Contractor, its subcontractors and teaming partners, and employees hereafter referred to collectively as “Contractor.”

subsections.title: 10.2 Format of Quotes
subsections.content:
In order to maximize efficiency and minimize the time for quotation evaluation, it is required that all Quoters submit their quotations in accordance with the format and content specified by the solicitation.
QUOTATION VOLUME COPIES FORMAT PAGE LIMITATIONS
0 Technical Volume 1 Electronic Copy ADOBE PDF 15 Pages
1 Resumes 1 Electronic Copy ADOBE PDF Not to Exceed 2 Pages per Resume.
2 Price 1 Electronic Copy MS EXCEL (required) + ADOBE PDF (format for optional supporting data) NONE

subsections.title: 10.3 Quotation Due Date
subsections.content: All Quotations shall be electronically submitted via email to scott.amos@opm.gov no later than: September 7, 2023 by 1:00 PM Eastern Time.

title: 11 INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING THE TECHNICAL PORTION OF THE QUOTE
content: Technical, and Pricing quotations MUST be in three separate volumes. If your technical and price quotations are not submitted in three separate files, your response to this solicitation may be considered non-responsive and may not be given any further consideration. Each of the parts shall be separate and complete, so that evaluation of one may be accomplished independently of and concurrently with the evaluation of the others.

subsections.title: 11.1 Technical Capability (Evaluation Factor 1)
subsections.content:
Under this section, the Quoter shall provide information on the following areas: 
Key Personnel Experience Submission Instructions: For this evaluation factor, the Contractor shall provide the names and qualifications of the Key Personnel proposed for this Task Order in the form of resumes and documentation of current, active technical certifications.  The contractor must clearly present the separate credentials for each of the proposed Key Personnel and must provide a concise summary of each individual’s separate duties and responsibilities as proposed for this Task Order. The contractor shall describe up to three (3) project examples demonstrating the experience of each individual designated as Key Personnel. Projects should be relevant examples of similar size, scope, and complexity.   
If the proposed Key Personnel is not a current employee of the Contractor, the Contractor shall include a signed commitment letter from the proposed staff resource that reflects his/her intention and willingness to perform in the event the Contractor is awarded the Task Order. 
Staffing Plan Submission Instructions: Contractors shall describe their staffing plan to ensure a stable and qualified workforce over the life of the Task Order by detailing their ability and approach to retaining qualified personnel, specifically: 
• 
The Contractor’s approach to managing resources while accommodating workload fluctuations, which includes identifying their use of subcontractors; and 
• 
The Contractor will provide their performance history as it pertains to historical retention rates on projects similar in size, scope and complexity to the subject requirements (e.g., % of contractor employees hired to perform under the project remained on the project at its completion) 
Management Approach Submission Instructions: Each Contractor shall describe their management approach to successfully fulfilling the requirements of the Task Order.  That approach will include the following: 
• 
A Project Management plan that will detail the Contractor’s ability to manage and balance technical performance, time constraints, cost factors and the management of subcontractor personnel, if applicable. The plan must detail how work will be accomplished in a logical sequence that will lead to successful performance, including how resources will be allocated and reasonableness of hours. 
• 
The management plan shall indicate any tasks that will be subcontracted, and how subcontracted work will be monitored. Lines of communication between the contractor, OPM, and subcontractors are to be carefully considered in the project organization. 
• 
A staffing plan showing labor hours and categories by task/sub-task shall demonstrate a well-developed approach for ensuring successful completion of this project. 
The submission shall be clearly indexed and logically assembled.  Each volume shall be clearly identified and shall begin at the top of a page.  All pages of each volume shall be appropriately numbered and identified by the complete company name, date and solicitation number in the header and/or footer.  A Table of Contents should be created using the Table of Contents feature in MS Word.  MS Word (.doc) files shall use the following Page Setup parameters: 
Margins – Top, Bottom, Left, Right - 1” 
Gutter – 0” 
From Edge – Header, Footer - 0.5” 
Page Size, Width – 8.5” 
Page Size, Height – 11” 
The following additional restrictions apply: 
• 
Each paragraph shall be separated by at least one blank line. 
• 
A standard, 11-point minimum font size applies.  
• 
Times New Roman font is required.  
• 
Tables and illustrations may use a reduced font size not less than 8-point and may be landscape. 
Quotation page limits are as follows: 
• 
Technical quotation – 15 pages maximum 
• 
Resumes – 2 Page maximum and are exclude from the technical quotation maximum page requirement 
• 
Price quotation – no page limit 
Quotes that exceed the page limits above may be considered non-responsive and may not be given any further consideration.  Page numbers, headers and footers may be within the page margins ONLY, and are not bound by the font requirements.  Company logos are prohibited with the exception of the Title Page. The page limits are applicable to graphs, tables, drawings and any other attachments submitted with the quotations and not specifically excluded by the solicitation.  Any index, table of contents, glossary or integrated master schedule will not be included in the maximum page limitation. 
The quoter is responsible for including sufficient details to permit a complete and accurate evaluation of each quote.  Each file of the quote shall consist of a Table of Contents, Summary Section and the Narrative discussion. The Summary Section shall contain a brief abstract of the file.  Proprietary information shall be clearly marked.

subsections.title: 11.2 ADDITIONAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR PREPARING THE TECHNICAL PORTION OF THE QUOTATION
subsections.content:
Quotes which merely offer to conduct the work in accordance with the requirements of the Government’s scope of work may be considered nonresponsive and may not receive future consideration.  The quoter must submit an explanation of the proposed technical approach in conjunction with the tasks to be performed in achieving the project objectives. 
Evaluation of the technical portion of quotations will be conducted by a technical review committee in accordance with the evaluation criteria stated in EVALUATION FACTORS in Paragraph 5.0 below. 
The submission shall be clearly indexed and logically assembled.  Each volume shall be clearly identified and shall begin at the top of a page.  All pages of each volume shall be appropriately numbered identified by the complete company name, date and solicitation number in the header and/or footer.

title: 12 EVALUATION CRITERIA AND BASIS FOR AWARD
content: This acquisition is being conducted in accordance with FAR 8.405-3(c)(2)(iii) and according to the GSA Federal Supply Schedule Ordering Procedures of FAR 8.405.  OPM will evaluate the quotations to determine the best value to the government.

subsections.title: 12.1 Basis for Task Order Award
subsections.content: Award will be made upon the basis of best value, utilizing trade-offs of non-price factors and price. The Task Order will be awarded to the Contractor whose quotation represents the overall best value to the Government.  The combined weight of the non-price factors is more important than price.  The evaluation factors below are listed in descending order of importance: Key Personnel Experience, Staffing Plan, and Management Approach.

subsections.title: 12.2 Key Personnel Experience
subsections.content: The proposed Key Personnel will be evaluated on relevant and demonstrated experience on projects of similar nature to the project in this Task Order, and their current relevant technical certifications. Proposed Key Personnel will be evaluated as to qualifications and experience in all areas necessary to effectively perform the required work of the Task Order. It is expected that the proposed Key Personnel will be the individuals who perform work under this contract.

subsections.title: 12.3 Key Personnel Requirements for This Task Order
subsections.content:
• 
Senior Project Manager - requires at least five (5) years of managerial experience as a Senior Project Manager of Federal Government information technology project(s) of this task order magnitude or larger as well as utilizing Agile methodologies in managing the projects and Microsoft Project for managing project schedules. 
• 
Enterprise Administrator Expert – requires at least five (5) years’ experience providing subject matter knowledge and experience in implementing, managing, and monitoring identity, governance, storage, computing and virtual networks in a cloud environment.  Microsoft O365 Certification is required. 
• 
Microsoft Power Platform Solution Architect – requires a current Microsoft Power Platform Solution Architect Expert certification and a minimum of 1 to 3 years as a Power Platform solution architect, or 7 to 10 years as a senior consultant or developer, along with deep knowledge of Power Platform architecture. 
• 
Microsoft Power Platform App Maker – requires a current Microsoft Power Platform App Maker Associate certification and at least one year of experience developing business solutions that automate tasks and processes.

subsections.title: 12.4 Staffing Plan
subsections.content:
OPM will evaluate the completeness and feasibility of the Task Order’s staffing plan to ensure a stable and qualified workforce over the life of the Task Order and its potential option periods, by review of the contractor’s ability and approach to staffing projects and retaining qualified personnel, specifically: 
• 
The Contractor’s use of current employees vs. subcontractors on the proposed project team; and 
• 
Identifying the contractor’s historical retention rates as it pertains to projects similar in size, scope, and complexity to the Task Order requirements (e.g., % of Contractor employees hired to perform similar Task Orders remained on the Task Order at its completion).

subsections.title: 12.5 Management Approach
subsections.content:
The evaluation of the Task Order’s management and staffing plan will consider the Contractor’s ability to manage and balance technical performance, time constraints, cost factors and the management of subcontractor personnel, if applicable. OPM will evaluate the Contractor’s plan for accomplishing the Task Order’s work in a logical sequence that will lead to successful performance. OPM will also evaluate allocation of resources and reasonableness of hours. 
Consensus Meeting:  A Technical Evaluation Team (TET) will be formed.  After individual evaluators review the Technical Volumes for each Offeror, an evaluation team Chair will convene a meeting(s) of the TET members to reach a consensus on the ratings and findings of each offeror in accordance with the stated Evaluation Factors.  A consensus does not mean a majority, although it could. 
The TET Chair shall lead the consensus meeting.  The individual evaluators may make notes during their reading.  The notes do not become part of the contract file.  During the meeting, the TET shall document its technical ratings and findings for each proposal. 
Consensus-only Evaluation Documentation:  The TET shall provide a Consensus Memo document which includes the ratings and rationale for the ratings for each proposal received in response to this solicitation, for each evaluation factor.

subsections.title: 12.6 Technical Capability (Factor 1)
subsections.content:
The table below shows the ratings the Government will assign in its evaluation of Technical Capability.
Adjectival Rating Description
0 High Confidence The Government has high confidence that the Quoter understands the requirement, proposes a sound approach, and/or will be successful in performing the work with no Government intervention.
1 Some Confidence The Government has some confidence that the Quoter understands the requirement, proposes a sound approach, and/or will be successful in performing the work with little or no Government intervention.
2 Low Confidence The Government has low confidence that the Quoter understands the requirement, proposes a sound approach, and/or will be successful in performing the work even with Government Intervention.
Price - Evaluation will be based on the extent to which price is fair and reasonable. Price will be assessed for completeness, reasonableness, and affordability. Past Performance - The Government reserves the right to obtain information for use in the evaluation of past performance from any and all sources including, but not limited to, the Contractor Performance Assessment Reporting System (CPARS), the System for Award Management Exclusions, and SAM Unique ID. No additional past performance submission is required. A written notice of award or acceptance of an offer, mailed or otherwise furnished to the successful offeror within the time for acceptance specified in the offer, shall result in a binding contract without further action by either party. Before the offer’s specified expiration time, the Government may accept a quote (or part of an quote), whether or not there are negotiations after its receipt, unless a written notice of withdrawal is received before award.
